name: smartseq2-isoform-analysis
title: Smart-seq2 Isoform & Splice Variant Analysis
description: Deep isoform analysis from Smart-seq2 full-length scRNA-seq. Quantify splice variants, detect novel isoforms, and perform allele-specific expression analysis at single-cell resolution.
content:
Single-Cell Isoform & Splicing Analysis

Leverage Smart-seq2's full-length coverage for detailed isoform quantification and splice variant analysis. Discover cell type-specific splicing patterns and alternative transcript usage at single-cell resolution.

Why Isoforms Matter

Same Gene → Different Functions

  • Alternative splicing generates protein diversity
  • ~95% of human multi-exon genes produce multiple isoforms
  • Isoforms can have opposing functions (e.g., pro- vs anti-apoptotic)
  • Cell type identity often defined by isoform expression

Isoform Analysis Capabilities

Splice Variant Detection:

  • Exon Skipping: Inclusion/exclusion events
  • Alternative 5'/3' Splice Sites: Partial exon usage
  • Intron Retention: Unspliced introns
  • Alternative TSS: Different transcription start sites
  • Alternative Poly-A Sites: 3' UTR length variation
  • Mutually Exclusive Exons: Choice between exons

Quantification:

  • Isoform-Level Counts: RSEM transcript quantification
  • PSI (Percent Spliced In): Exon inclusion ratios
  • Isoform Ratios: Relative abundance per gene
  • Dominant Isoform: Most expressed per cell

Scientific Questions

  • Cell Type Splicing: Do T cells vs B cells use different CD45 isoforms?
  • Developmental Switching: How does PKM1/PKM2 ratio change in differentiation?
  • Activation States: Which TCR isoforms in naive vs activated T cells?
  • Disease Mechanisms: Are aberrant isoforms cancer-specific?
  • Drug Targets: Can we target disease-specific isoforms?

Key Isoform Examples

CD45 (PTPRC) - 8 major isoforms:

  • CD45RA (naive T cells)
  • CD45RO (memory T cells)
  • Functional difference: membrane vs cytoplasmic

BCL-X - Life vs death:

  • BCL-xL: anti-apoptotic (long isoform)
  • BCL-xS: pro-apoptotic (short isoform)
  • Balance determines cell fate

FGFR2 - Epithelial-mesenchymal:

  • IIIb: epithelial-specific
  • IIIc: mesenchymal-specific
  • Switch during EMT

Pipeline Analysis

  1. Splice-Aware Alignment: STAR maps reads across splice junctions
  2. Isoform Quantification: RSEM estimates transcript abundance
  3. Splice Junction Calling: Detect all junction reads
  4. Novel Isoform Detection: StringTie assembles unannotated transcripts
  5. Differential Isoform Usage: Compare isoform ratios between cell types
  6. Allelic Expression: Phase isoforms to haplotypes (if variants known)

Applications

  • Immunology: TCR/BCR isoform diversity, CD45 isoforms
  • Neuroscience: Neurotransmitter receptor variants, synaptic isoforms
  • Cancer: Oncogenic isoforms (MDM2, p53, BCR-ABL variants)
  • Development: Stage-specific isoform switching
  • Stem Cells: Pluripotency vs differentiation isoforms
  • Disease Modeling: Pathogenic splice variants

Advantages of Smart-seq2 for Isoforms

FeatureSmart-seq210XShort-read bulk
Full-length✅ Yes❌ 3'/5' only✅ Yes
Single-cell✅ Yes✅ Yes❌ Bulk
Isoform resolution✅ High❌ Poor✅ High
Cell heterogeneity✅ Resolved✅ Resolved❌ Averaged

Input Requirements

Paired-end FASTQs with wildcard pattern (same as smartseq2-full-length)

Key Outputs

  • Isoform × Cell Matrix: Transcript-level counts
  • Splice Junction Counts: All detected junctions
  • PSI Values: Exon inclusion percentages
  • Novel Isoforms: Unannotated transcripts (GTF)
  • Differential Isoform Usage: Switching events between cell types
  • Isoform Diversity Metrics: Shannon entropy per gene

Perfect for: Isoform quantification • Splice variant discovery • Cell type splicing • Developmental isoforms • Disease isoforms • Drug target discovery
